Daniel Defoe was a prolific English writer known for his works of fiction and non-fiction. Additionally, Defoe also wrote 'A Journal of the Plague Year,' a fictionalized but historically accurate account of the Great Plague of London in 1665.

The author of 'The Shortest Way with Dissenters' and 'A Journal of the Plague Year' is Daniel Defoe.
